searchDocs.title: Register Process​
searchDocs.content: To start using our service, begin by registering for a free account. The username you choose will serve as your alias channel with the structure a_<your_username>. Upon successful registration, all duotail.com emails starting with this alias belong to you.    Name: Enter your full name. This will appear as the sender name for all outgoing emails. (Length: 5–60 characters).User Name: This is your login ID. It must be between 5–32 characters and may only contain lowercase English letters, digits, and dots. Note: A dot cannot be used at the beginning or the end of the username.Password: Your password must be between 12–64 characters. It must include at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, one digit, and one special character (any standard English keyboard symbol).Email: Provide your primary inbox address where you wish to receive forwarded emails. A confirmation link will be sent here. You cannot use a duotail.com address for this field.  Once you click the Register button, you will be directed to a "Registration Success" screen. Simultaneously, a confirmation email will be sent to your provided email address.

searchDocs.title: Confirmation Email​
searchDocs.content: The confirmation email will be sent by donotreply@duotail.com with title New Email Confirmation. It's content look like the example below. To finalize your registration and activate your account, simply click the link provided in the message.  The confirmation link is valid for only thirty minutes upon issuing. You can request another confirmation email through your Account page if the link is expired.    Note: If you haven't whitelisted duotail.com in your inbox, the confirmation email may be in your spam/junk folder.

searchDocs.title: Related Topics​
searchDocs.content: You may also want to check out the following related topics  Alias Channel Whitelist Our Domain

searchDocs.title: What is a channel​
searchDocs.content: A channel acts as an "umbrella" for all email addresses starting with its name. For example, owning the channel a_happy.rhino gives you ownership over any emails starting with a_happy.rhino, for example a_happy.rhino@duotail.com, a_happy.rhino_sports@duotail.com, and a_happy.rhino_food@duotail.com.

searchDocs.title: Channel Email​
searchDocs.content: A channel email is an address where the local part (the text before the @ symbol) matches the specific channel name. For example, the channel a_happy.rhino uses the email address a_happy.rhino@duotail.com as its channel email.

searchDocs.title: Security and Contact Managemen​
searchDocs.content: Channel emails operate on a whitelist-only basis; only senders included in the channel's contact list are permitted to send messages to that address. Additionally, when an outgoing email is sent via the channel, the recipient is automatically added to the contact list to ensure seamless future communication.

searchDocs.title: Channel Type​
searchDocs.content: There are two types of channel: alias channel and identity channel.

searchDocs.title: Alias Channel​
searchDocs.content: An Alias Channel is provided to all users who wish to utilize our services without verifying their legal identity. We believe everyone deserves an email address that isn't tied to their real-world persona. Consequently, every account includes at least one default alias channel, following the format: a_<your_username>@duotail.com.  All our alias channel starts with a prefix "a_". So, via the email address itself, the recipients of these emails should be able to tell if they from an anonymous sender. For example, a person received an email from a_harry.potter@duotail.com, he can tell the sender is A Harry Potter not The Harry Potter.

searchDocs.title: Identity Channel​
searchDocs.content: An Identity Channel is assigned to users whose real-world identities have been successfully verified. Unlike alias channels, an Identity Channel email address has no prefix (e.g., isaac.swordblessing@duotail.com). This serves as a "verified badge," signaling to recipients that the sender's identity is authentic and confirmed.

searchDocs.title: Purpose​
searchDocs.content: Our mission is simple: to provide every user with total control over their inbox and how they receive email.  We're convinced that every person deserves a curated inbox. To make that a reality, we provide our full suite of incoming email controls to all customers, free of charge.

searchDocs.title: Key Concepts​
searchDocs.content: To get the most out of our services, it is important to understand these three core concepts:  Channel: A channel acts as an "umbrella" for all email addresses starting with its name. For example, owning the channel a_happy.rhino gives you control over a_happy.rhino@duotail.com, a_happy.rhino_sports@duotail.com, and a_happy.rhino_food@duotail.com. More details can be found in the channel guide. Route: A Route defines the rules for incoming emails. The text following the last underscore in an address is the Route ID. For example, in a_happy.rhino_food@duotail.com, "food" is the route. If a route rule allows deliciousgrass.com, any emails from that domain will be delivered to your inbox. Contact: A Contact is a trusted sender assigned to a channel. Emails originating from a Contact bypass Route configurations to reach any address under that channel. For example, if angry.gazelle@example.com is a Contact for a_happy.rhino, their emails will always be delivered to a_happy.rhino@duotail.com, _sports, and _food regardless of specific route rules.

searchDocs.title: What You'll Need​
searchDocs.content: As our service is in its early stages, our domain is still being recognized by major email providers. To ensure you receive our communications, please whitelist duotail.com in your email settings. This will prevent our messages from being incorrectly flagged as junk.  Gmail Guide Outlook Guide

searchDocs.title: Getting Started​
searchDocs.content: To try our service, you can sign up for a free account. Upon successful registration, you will own the channel a_<your_username>. For example, a user named happy.rhino would own the channel a_happy.rhino.

searchDocs.title: Get Support​
searchDocs.content: We are happy to assist you with any issues or answer any questions you may have. You can reach us through these two main channels:  Technical support: support@duotail.comOther concerns: contact@duotail.com

searchDocs.title: How to Ensure Duotail Emails Reach Your Inbox
Why is this necessary?​
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Ensure Duotail Emails Reach Your Inbox
searchDocs.content: Our service is in its early stages, and major providers are still learning to recognize our domain. Without whitelist our domain, your emails through our service will be sent to junk/spam folder. By setting this filter, you are telling your provider that you trust duotail.com, which helps us improve our reputation and ensures your emails reach your inbox as intended.

searchDocs.title: Whitelist in Gmail​
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Ensure Duotail Emails Reach Your Inbox

searchDocs.title: Option 1​
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Ensure Duotail Emails Reach Your Inbox
searchDocs.content: Step 1: Log into your Gmail account on a browser and type from:(duotail.com) in the top search bar then click show search options icon.    Step 2: Click Create filter link at the right bottom of the dropdown window.    Step 3: Check option Never send it to Spam then click Create filter button at the bottom. As optional, you can set Categorize as: Primary.

searchDocs.title: Option 2​
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Ensure Duotail Emails Reach Your Inbox
searchDocs.content: Step 1: Log in to your Gmail account and click the Settings (gear icon) in the top right corner, then select See all settings.  Step 2: Navigate to Filters Click on the Filters and Blocked Addresses tab at the top of the menu.  Step 3: Create a New Filter Scroll down and click on Create a new filter.  Step 4: Enter the Domain in the From field, type: duotail.com  Step 5: Click Create filter at the bottom of the window.  Step 6: Configure the Actions Check the following boxes to ensure delivery:  Never send it to Spam Categorize as: Primary (It's optional)  Step 7: Save the Filter Click Create filter to confirm.

searchDocs.title: Whitelist in Outlook​
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Ensure Duotail Emails Reach Your Inbox
searchDocs.content: Step 1: Log in to your Outlook account and click the Settings (gear icon) in the top right corner.  Step 2: Select Mail > Junk email in the popup window  Step 3: Click Add safe sender button from the Safe senders and domains tab  Step 4: Type duotail.com in the text box and click OK button  Step 5: Click Save button to save the change.
